title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
The CFPB is preparing to prod banks to pay back more customers who are the victims of alleged scams on money-transfer services, according to people familiar with the coming regulatory effort.

U.S. stock indexes jumped as investors reacted positively to a fresh batch of earnings. The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow gained 2.8%, 3.1% and 2.4%, respectively.

Amazon said it sued the administrators of what it says are more than 10,000 Facebook groups used to coordinate fake reviews of Amazon products.

Chinese authorities are preparing to impose a fine of more than $1 billion on Didi after a yearlong probe into the ride-hailing company's cybersecurity practices.

Facebook is reallocating resources from news as the company focuses more on the creator economy, senior executive Campbell Brown told employees.

J&J reported a decline in profit for the latest quarter and cut its full-year sales and profit guidance.

What's News: Business & Finance
